p.s: After Abe discussed Muslim repression in a Starbucks with a Kufi on his head and a friend who annoyed the barista who waited them, the barista suspected them both of terrorism and reported them to the police.
Abe, who chose to change his name back to Hussein, was therefore interrogated by the FBIFederal Bureau of Investigation and now his immigration status is back on discussion.
In his hearing or interrogation Abe (Hussein) laughed out loud after the authorities announced that his status is up for renewal.
Abe's uncle, Amir, reacts shocked to Abe's behaviour and the situation he got himself in.
In Amir's mind it would be the best to work together with the FBIFederal Bureau of Investigation in case this could improve the current situation for Abe.
He calls Ken, a lawyer on Imam Fareed's case, and asks for his help on the matter urgently.
A part of Amir's ideas to support his nephew is to convince him to watch what he says and how he acts once he steps outside of his home.
Amir thinks it is important for Abe to realize that they do not live in a neutral world and need to be cautious at all times.
For his help however, Amir states that respect against him is a condition Abe needs to follow.

All in all, Abe's situation is quite dangerous as he does not know what his future in the US will hold at all - or if there even is one - and Amir's ideas to support him are generally defensive and trying to back down in front of the legal system in the USA.
